text:
Estuary Edges Talk: 11am, 28th October!

There is one week to go until our Technical Director, Amy Pryor, joins Richard Charman from @EnvAgency to look at the positive benefits of softening brick, concrete and metal tidal walls on the #Thames.

Click here: https://t.co/6d2eSNjcFx https://t.co/cWEXEzfKM2

You should have backed us on that as well!

text: @bill_brierley @carlsayerUCL @frankiecoed @Riverflies @EnvAgency @freshwaterbio ARMI is also a great example of a citizen science “early warning system”. Many volunteers care about the state of their rivers and want to help, but all too often their efforts - and data - go unnoticed. @Riverflies is a great exception to this 🙂

@marketinghumber @EnvAgency I think @RewildingB @RewildingEurope is a good starter ... the bigger the scale the better the benefits. But starting small is also beneficial.... I also like the sound of vertical green spaces and vertical food production

Riverfly monitoring @Riverflies - probably one of longest running freshwater citizen science initiatives in UK - green dots are @Riverflies sites, red and blue dots are @EnvAgency sites  @freshwaterbio https://t.co/uomfw4j1jQ
